definition: A custodial sentence in the Japanese penal system, imposing mandatory labor on the inmate. This is distinct from Imprisonment without Labor (Kinko), which does not mandate labor but permits voluntary work.
japaneseDefinition: 刑務所に拘置し、所定の作業を行わせる自由刑。日本の刑罰において重い刑の一つであり、作業が義務ではない禁錮（きんこ）と区別される。
legalContext: Criminal Code Art. 12, Paragraph 1: Imprisonment with Labor shall be categorized as limited term (one month or more, up to 20 years) or indefinite term, and the sentenced person shall be confined in a penal institution and subjected to prescribed labor.
japaneseLegalContext: 刑法第12条第1項: 懲役は、有期及び無期とし、懲役囚を刑務所に拘置し、所定の作業を行わせる。
exampleSentence: Due to the severity of the financial fraud, the defendant received a sentence of eight years of imprisonment with labor.
exampleTranslation: その金融詐欺の深刻さから、被告人は懲役8年の判決を受けた。

vocabularyList.translation: 所定の作業 (しょていのさぎょう)
